name: OpenTelemetry Mule 4 Observablity Agent
description: This is the main class of an extension, is the entry point from which configurations, connection providers, operations and sources are going to be declared.

displayModel.summary: Enable/Disable all tracing in this application.  If disabled, all other configuration details will be ignored.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy
parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

displayModel.summary: Logical (unique) name for this application (e.g., shoppingcart, productAPI, ...).

Optional attributes for this application defined as <key,value> pairs(e.g., service.namespace:com.mycompany, service.version:0.0.1, ...). Attributes provide context to a distributed trace which can help with correlations to proivde a clear view of what was involved when performance changes occur.
Traget URL to which the OTLP Exporter sends traces. Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS.
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP trace server's TLS credentials. The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
The maximum number of spans in the waiting queue. Any new spans are dropped once the queue is full.
The maximum number of spans to export in a single batch.
The delay interval in milliseconds between two consecutive batch exports.
Maximum time (milliseconds) the OTLP exporter will wait for a batch to export before cancelling the export.
Key-value pairs separated by commas to pass as request headers on an OTLP trace.
Generate Message Processor spans and them to the trace
List of Message Processors to bypass when generating Message Processor spans.

parameters.name: outputMimeType
parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameters.name: targetValue
parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

description.value: How many reconnection attempts to make

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operations.name: retrieveConfigInfo
operations.description: Example of an operation that uses the configuration and a connection instance to perform some action.

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
How many reconnection attempts to make

parameters.name: reconnection
parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

displayModel.summary: Provide the namespace for this component (e.g., http, mule, db, ...
Provide the name for this component (e.g., listener, requester, select, ...
